revised_title: The Adaptation of the Pancreas to Different Food-Stuffs and the Production of Lactase
tldr: The author conducted experiments to determine if the pancreas adapts to different food-stuffs and how it produces lactase. They found that when dogs are fed milk, their pancreas secretes lactase, a ferment that breaks down milk sugar. This indicates that the pancreas can modify its secretion based on the food it receives, suggesting that the adaptation is due to a chemical stimulus rather than a nervous mechanism.
